GPUAdapterInfo.summary: The GPUAdapterInfo interface of the {{domxref("WebGPU API", "WebGPU API", "", "nocode")}} contains identifying information about a .

remarks.para: An adapter's GPUAdapterInfo can be retrieved using the property of the adapter itself, or the property of a device that originated from the adapter.

This object allows developers to access specific details about the user's GPU so that they can preemptively apply workarounds for GPU-specific bugs, or provide different codepaths to better suit different GPU architectures. Providing such information does present a security risk — it could be used for fingerprinting — therefore the information shared is kept at a minimum, and different browser vendors are likely to share different information types and granularities.

GPUAdapterInfoSubgroupMinSize.summary: The subgroupMinSize read-only property of the interface returns the minimum supported subgroup size for the . This can be used along with the subgroups feature.

GPUAdapterInfoArchitecture.summary:
The architecture read-only property of the
interface returns the name of the family or class of GPUs the adapter belongs to, or an empty string if it is not available.

GPUAdapterInfoSubgroupMaxSize.summary: The subgroupMaxSize read-only property of the interface returns the maximum supported subgroup size for the . This can be used along with the subgroups feature.

GPUAdapterInfoDescription.summary:
The description read-only property of the
interface returns a human-readable string describing the adapter, or an empty string if it is not available.

GPUAdapterInfoVendor.summary:
The vendor read-only property of the
interface returns the name of the adapter vendor, or an empty string if it is not available.

GPUAdapterInfoDevice.summary:
The device read-only property of the
interface returns a vendor-specific identifier for the adapter, or an empty string if it is not available.
